alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued December 23 at 12:12AM CST until December 24 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 27 possible. * WHERE...Inland Cameron, Coastal Willacy and Coastal Cameron Counties. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until noon CST today. For the Wind Advisory, until 9 AM CST this morning. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Cameron; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron
